item.title: Arcade Archives 2 Aqua Jet announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2; Arcade Archives Aqua Jet for PS4 and Switch
item.content:encoded:
Hamster Corporation, in cooperation with Bandai Namco, has announced Arcade Archives Aqua Jet for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2, and Arcade Archives Aqua Jet for PlayStation 4 and Switch. The former will cost $16.99, while the latter will cost $14.99. Users who purchase the PlayStation 4 or Switch versions will be able to upgrade to the PlayStation 5 or Switch 2 versions for $2.99. It will launch on August 14.

Here is an overview of the game, via Hamster Corporation:

Aqua Jet is a marine sports game released by Namco Limited (current Bandai Namco Entertainment Inc.) in 1996. This game stood out at arcades at the time thanks to its large jet ski-style cabinet. Savor the thrill of racing across shimmering waves under the blazing sun in a stunning, resort-like setting brought to life by the System Super 22 hardware!

The Arcade Archives (ACA) series faithfully reproduces classic arcade game masterpieces, staying true to its original. You can customize game settings to your liking, such as adjusting the difficulty level, and depending on the title, even recreate the nostalgic atmosphere of CRT TVs back in the day. Additionally, you can compete for high scores with players from all around the world through online rankings.

In addition to the “Original Mode,” “High Score Mode,” and “Caravan Mode” included in the Arcade Archives series, Arcade Archives 2 series will add new features such as “Time Attack Mode” and “Network Mode.” In “Time Attack Mode” you compete to see who can beat the final boss the fastest stating from the first battle. This mode focuses on how quickly you can complete the game, regardless of the score you achieve. In “Network Mode” you can play against other users over the network. However, “Time Attack Mode” and “Network Mode” may not be implemented in some games.

Additionally, functionality has been significantly enhanced. Multiple save slots have been implemented instead of just one, along with a rewind feature that allows players to retry gameplay and a quick start feature for those who want to dive straight into the game. Furthermore, VRR support has been added, enabling more accurate reproduction of the original arcade game’s experience.

Enjoy the legendary arcade masterpiece with Arcade Archives 2, now more fun and user-friendly.

item.title: INSTINCT3 establishes indie games publisher Sidekick Publishing
item.content:encoded:
Deadly Days: Roadtrip the first title slated for release under the label.

Berlin-based creative agency INSTINCT3 has announced the establishment of Sidekick Publishing, a full-service publisher for indie, A, and AA game studios.

The publisher aims to “fill a gap in the competitive publishing landscape,” leveraging its global publishing expertise with INSTINCT3’s creator-led marketing and community building expertise.

The new venture is led by industry veterans Jasmin Oestreicher and Melvin Frank.

“After ten years in publishing and marketing and the past four years at our agency, serving as managing director since 2024, I know how valuable experience can be,” said INSTINCT3 CEO and Sidekick Publishing co-CEO and co-founder Jasmin Oestreicher in a press release. “But I also know how quickly you can lose touch if you rely too much on the past. Especially with a gaming audience that is highly sensitive to inauthentic or overly commercial content, what matters are bold ideas, local sensitivity, and creators who work for lasting impact, not just quick profit.”

Sidekick Publishing co-CEO and co-founder Melvin Frank added, “Over the past year, we’ve worked on a variety of releases—each one teaching us something new about what works, what connects, and what lasts for our concept. Sidekick is our way of taking all those lessons, combining them with our unique creator and community expertise, and raising the bar for how we support indie developers. The goals are simple: focus on games that resonate well with our approach and make every next launch our best one yet.”

The first game slated for release under the Sidekick Publishing brand will be 2.5D pixel zombie apocalypse roguelike action game Deadly Days: Roadtrip from developer Pixelsplit, which is due out for PC via Steam in 2025.
